node.title: RAT supply crisis shows little sign of ending, with major deliveries weeks away
node.alt: A man looking inside a chemist, with a sign saying no covid tests.
node.description: The shortage of rapid antigen tests on retail shelves shows little sign of abating in January, with a major increase in deliveries still weeks away.
node.content:
["Australians are desperately searching for rapid antigen tests (RATs), but retail supplies remain limited and are unlikely to improve significantly for several weeks.", "The tests have been recommended by state and federal health authorities as a preferable alternative to PCR COVID-19 tests, with testing centres and laboratories overwhelmed by the surge in Omicron cases.", "Aside from individual peace of mind, negative RAT or PCR results are required by\u00a0some people to go to work or, in some states, to leave isolation after being a COVID-19 close contact.", "Melbourne-based Melanie Sawyer has been in isolation for about a week, along with her 18-year-old daughter and 15-year-old son, after her 20-year-old\u00a0daughter tested positive to COVID-19.", "", "
Melanie Sawyer, pictured with her daughter Frances, struggled to obtain RAT kits for her family.(Supplied: Melanie Sawyer)
", "She told ABC News she had now been waiting seven days for the results of her initial PCR test.", "After testing negative using a rapid antigen test on day one, Melanie and her family had\u00a0been unable to obtain further RATs.", "Family members tried to obtain a test for her from various Melbourne pharmacies without success.", "In one case, she was told, a pharmacy shut early after seemingly being rushed following a report of availability on the Find a RAT website.", "In another instance, Ms Sawyer\u00a0said her boss managed to purchase a RAT, but by the time the boss's\u00a0daughter came to the store 10 minutes later\u00a0they were sold out.", "", "
Signs like this have become commonplace at pharmacies across Australia.(ABC News: Kimberley Bernard)
", "\"How are you supposed to get them?\" she said.", "\"Some sites say that's the end of January.\"", "Unlike some other states, in Victoria a negative RAT or PCR taken on day six after close contact with a COVID case is required to leave isolation.", "Ms Sawyer and her two younger children were facing the prospect of being stuck in isolation beyond seven days, despite no COVID symptoms, because of the lack of tests.", "However, late on Tuesday she managed to secure some RATs from the Melbourne University COVID-19 testing site.", "Some states and territories are making RATs available at testing sites or public health centres as an alternative to PCRs for close contacts and certain other categories of people.", "
RAT supply surge weeks away, pharmacy giant warns
", "For those who do not qualify for state-supplied RATs, however, obtaining one from a pharmacy or supermarket is likely to remain challenging for the next few weeks.", "Major pharmacy operator API,\u00a0which owns the Priceline, Soul Pattinson and Pharmacist advice brands,\u00a0said it expected\u00a0supplies of tests would\u00a0not increase significantly until February.", "\"API received 500,000 tests last week, will receive a further 250,000 this week and again next week, staying at that level until 2.75 million arrive in mid-February,\" the company told the ABC.", "\"We understand that other wholesalers have similar availability challenges in the short term.", "Australia's other big chain pharmacy operator, Chemist Warehouse, said it also expected supplies to increase over the next few weeks.", "\"We have RAT stock regularly being distributed to our stores around the country, however the demand is still currently outstripping the supplied stock,\"\u00a0Mario Tascone, a Chemist Warehouse director, told ABC News via email.", "\"In saying this, the situation will improve in the weeks ahead and we are committed to doing everything we can to provide our customers with accessible and affordable rapid testing.\"", "Supermarket giant Woolworths said it had\u00a0a large shipment of \"hundreds of thousands\" of RATs arriving this week and going into stores and its online channels.", "However, a spokesman said the tests were selling out quickly when they hit the shelves, which was why the supermarket had a limit of one test pack per customer, per transaction.", "Rival Coles also has a one-pack purchase limit in place. A\u00a0spokesperson said the retailer was\u00a0\"regularly replenishing stocks for our stores\".", "
Importers and manufacturers scramble to catch up
", "Both supermarkets are mainly selling test kits imported by Hough Pharma.", "The company told the ABC that imports of tests would\u00a0double by the end of this month.", "\"We will be supplying our retail partners with more than 2 million rapid tests a week over the next couple of weeks and 4 million a week by the end of January,\" a Hough Pharma spokesperson said.", "It is a similar story for US multinational Abbott, which is importing tests into Australia that are available through government and community channels, while \"ramping up availability\" through retailers over the first few months of this year.", "\"We're seeing unprecedented demand for rapid testing in Australia and we're sending the tests out as fast as we can make them,\" a spokesperson told the ABC.", "\"We're ramping up supplies of Abbott's Panbio rapid antigen tests across the country.\"", "While the company has already sold more than a billion RATs globally, only a fraction of those are heading to Australia.", "\"We expect tens of thousands of COVID-19 rapid antigen tests becoming available in the country over the coming weeks,\" the spokesperson said.", "", "
How to speak to your kids about their COVID-19 vaccination
"]
